metadata.feature_description: Retrieve global URL management configuration including locale settings and sorting options

steps.action: Navigate to Persona Bar > Settings > SEO > URL Management
steps.expected: URL Management configuration panel should load with General Settings tab selected
steps.actual: URL Management panel loaded successfully with General Settings tab selected, displaying URL Rewriter and URL Redirects configuration sections

steps.expected: All URL management configuration options should be visible with current values
steps.actual: All configuration options displayed correctly: Standard Replacement Character ('-'), Concatenate Page URLs (On), Convert URLs to Lowercase (Off), Convert Accented Characters (Off), Set Default Site Language (On), Redirect deleted/expired/disabled pages to (404 Error), Redirect to Friendly URLs (On), Redirect Mixed Case URLs (Off)

steps.action: Observe locale indicators in the portal header
steps.expected: Locale flags should be visible indicating multi-locale support
steps.actual: Multiple locale flags visible (en-US, es-AR, fr-FR, de-DE, ar-ER), confirming SingleLocale=false is correctly reflected in the UI. The Set Default Site Language option is enabled which is consistent with multi-locale portal configuration.

observations: The GetConfiguration() API returns SingleLocale flag and SortingFields enum values (None, Url, Locale, Status) which are used by the UI for display and sorting logic
The portal has 5 locales enabled (en-US, es-AR, fr-FR, de-DE, ar-ER), so SingleLocale returns false as expected
Configuration caching behavior could not be directly tested via UI as it is handled at the API/server level
Testing with different portal settings would require switching portal context which is beyond the scope of smoke testing
